snippet: A claim by Mr. Gross was the basis of the so-called Prague connection, an unsubstantiated allegation that linked the Sept. 11 attackers to Saddam Hussein’s regime, bolstering the case for invading Iraq.
abstract: Stanislav Gross, who in 2004 became Czech Republic's youngest prime minister at age 34 and whose allegations of terrorist activity played small role in buildup to Iraq War, dies at age 45.
lead_paragraph: A claim by Mr. Gross was the basis of the so-called Prague connection, an unsubstantiated allegation that linked the Sept. 11 attackers to Saddam Hussein’s regime, bolstering the case for invading Iraq.

headline.main: Stanislav Gross, Czech Leader Who Erred on Iraq Link to 9/11, Dies at 45
headline.print_headline: Stanislav Gross, 45, Czech Who Made 9/11 Link to Iraq
